question:
Which of the following monuments reflects the Indo-Saracenic architecture?
1) Municipal Corporation Building, Mumbai
2) Madras High court Building
3) Victoria Memorial, Kolkata
Select the correct answer from the codes given below:
explanation: Indo-Saracenic, also known as Indo-Gothic, was a revival architectural style mostly used by British architects in India in the later 19th century. Municipal Corporation Building, Mumbai, Madras High court Building, and Victoria Memorial, Kolkata are some of the finest examples.
